question.content:
The restriction enzyme (RE) BamHI recognizes the sequence $\text{GGATCC}$. The image below depicts the recognition site in double stranded DNA.

![](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/53fad6dea2efd70fa375647c191d61e9e039d418.svg)

**From the following scenarios, identify the one that would result in sticky ends (cut sites are marked by red arrows).**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: REs cut at the same position on both strands (reading $5’$ to $3’$). Here, the cut is between the  two $G$s on the upper strand, but between the two $C$s on the lower.
Restriction enzymes make cuts within the recognition site, not outside of it.
This would result in what is known as ‘blunt ends’. Sticky ends should have unpaired nucleotides, or overhangs.

BamHI would cut between the two $G$s on both strands to create unpaired overhangs that can form hydrogen bonds with complementary DNA.

![](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/2dfe8b8455c7c2ddd099433f957a18d7f7885eb6.svg)
